metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2038 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The NMEA0183 driver in gpsd before 3.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon termination) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a GPS packet with a malformed $GPGGA interpreted sentence that lacks certain fields and a terminator.  NOTE: a separate issue in the AIS driver was also reported, but it might not be a vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2038` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gpsd - 3.9-3
gpsd-clients - 3.9-3
libgps20 - 3.9-3
libqgpsmm20 - 3.9-3
python-gps - 3.9-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gpsd package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9-3').
